messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: Dur1ng the early m0rning h0urs of the investigati0n, it was rep0rted that a susp1cious individual was seen leav1ng the area. Officer Terrence McD0well, who was on night patrol, was dispatched to the scene. Upon arr1val, Officer McD0well and his partner, Patrol Officer Linda Juarez, quickly sec0red the area and began canvassing for any potential witnesses. Meanwhile, Detective Jameson O'Conner, along with his colleague Detective Andrea L1vetti, took the lead on the case. Their efforts were supported by Sergeant Elijah Moreno who coordinated the broader search operations, including setting up checkpoints and gathering surveillance footage from nearby establishments. Crime lab Technician Emily Sanchez was called to process the scene for forensic evidence. She was later joined by Coroner Dr. Henry Kim, who examined the body for the preliminary cause of death. The two worked meticulously, often cross-referencing details with Criminalist Dr. Rachel Abrams, who specialized in blood pattern analysis. As the day progressed, Lieutenant Marcus Trenton briefed the press on the developments and reiterated the department's commitment to solving the case swiftly. Captain Geraldine Herrera monitored the progress from the central command, ensuring all units were functioning cohesively. Deputy Chief Nathanial Briggs was overseeing the entire operation, making sure resources were allocated effectively to aid the investigation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Officer Terrence McDowellOfficer Context: Was dispatched to the scene during the early morning hours after a suspicious individual was reported leaving the area.Officer Role: Night Patrol OfficerOfficer Name: Patrol Officer Linda JuarezOfficer Context: Accompanied Officer McDowell to secure the area and canvass for potential witnesses.Officer Role: Patrol OfficerOfficer Name: Detective Jameson O'ConnerOfficer Context: Took the lead on the case along with Detective Andrea Livetti.Officer Role: Lead DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Andrea LivettiOfficer Context: Worked with Detective O'Conner as the lead on the case.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Sergeant Elijah MorenoOfficer Context: Coordinated the broader search operations, including setting up checkpoints and gathering surveillance footage.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Technician Emily SanchezOfficer Context: Called to process the crime scene for forensic evidence.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Coroner Dr. Henry KimOfficer Context: Examined the body for the preliminary cause of death at the crime scene.Officer Role: CoronerOfficer Name: Criminalist Dr. Rachel AbramsOfficer Context: Specialized in blood pattern analysis and worked in conjunction with other crime scene investigators.Officer Role: CriminalistOfficer Name: Lieutenant Marcus TrentonOfficer Context: Briefed the press on the developments of the case.Officer Role: LieutenantOfficer Name: Captain Geraldine HerreraOfficer Context: Monitored the progress of the investigation from the central command.Officer Role: CaptainOfficer Name: Deputy Chief Nathanial BriggsOfficer Context: Oversaw the entire operation, ensuring effective resource allocation for the investigation.Officer Role: Deputy Chief
